basics.name: Skyler Kimura
basics.label: Graduate Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a Masters of Science in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

work.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa - Climate Resilience Collaborative
work.summary: Maintain and build software for research group
highlights:
Collaborated with an interdisciplinary team to deploy a metadata
        catalog using Docker for easy public data discovery

Enhanced real-time geospatial data delivery for project stakeholders
        by leveraging GeoServer’s WMS capabilities
Developed tool in Python to seamlessly interact with Geoserver’s REST API

work.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa - Climate Resilience Collaborative
highlights:
Developed and deployed new features for web mapping application using
        Javascript, HTML, and CSS, allowing real-time visualization of data.

Configured and deployed a Geoserver Docker Cluster using RabbitMQ, Prometheus,
        and Grafana, significantly improving system performance and
        facilitating real-time analysis of system metrics.

Developed a comprehensive cataloging service in Laravel using PHP, Livewire, and TailwindCSS with
        a PostgreSQL database and deployed on Fly.io cloud platform.

work.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa - Research Computing Facilities
work.summary: Provided technical support for research faculty and staff
highlights:
Provided IT support to faculty and staff within the SOEST department, improving operational efficiency
        and ensuring seamless technology integration.
Streamlined workflows by automating tasks with Bash scripts significantly improving operational efficiency.
